> However, whenever I did so, I get message "No tests found in HelloWorld"
> and none of my overridden methods are called.  Not very friendly.

IIRC when you invoke the TestRunner and if you haven't defined any 'suite()'
method in your test, JUnit automatically creates a TestSuite with your test. 
The TestSuite doesn' find any test in your TestCase class and you get the "No
tests found in HelloWorld".

If this is right, defining a suite() method into your TestCase will solve your
problem.

-Vladimir
